string-array.name: menu_strings
string-array.item: Get info on current framerate and calculation period

resources.string: The view for the down-scaled preview image
Set color mode to RGB negative
"Are you sure you want to quit VideOSC?"
Fixed framerate. Unchecking this option may improve color recoginition in dark environments yet result in a decreased frame rate.
Normalize output (0.0–1.0, does not apply to sensor values).
Orientation sensor: Rotation in degrees – \'/%1$s/ori\', x, y, z, timestamp, accuracy
Accelerometer: Force in m/s^2 – \'/%1$s/acc\', x, y, z, timestamp, accuracy
Linear acceleration sensor: m/s^2 minus gravity – \'/%1$s/lin_acc\', x, y, z, timestamp, accuracy
Magnetic field sensor: Geomagnetic field in µT – \'/%1$s/mag\', x, y, z, timestamp, accuracy
Gravity sensor: Force of gravity in m/s^2 – \'/%1$s/grav\', x, y, z, timestamp, accuracy
Proximity sensor: Distance from sensor, typically 0, 5 – \'/%1$s/prox\', distance, timestamp, accuracy
Light sensor: Illumination from sensor in lx – \'/%1$s/light\', illumination, timestamp, accuracy
Air pressure sensor: Ambient pressure in hPa or mbar – \'/%1$s/press\', pressure, timestamp, accuracy
The camera failed to open. Possibly you will have to restart the device.

Add the number of OSC sending attempts and the number of actually sent OSC messages as additional slots to OSC messages: When sending pixel values over OSC some packets may get dropped. This setting should give a clear picture on how many packets actually get lost.
The following settings will not get stored permanently. They will get reset with every restart of VideOSC.
Fix exposure temporarily (will be reset on restart)
Point your device at the lighting situation you want the camera exposure to be set to and hit OK.
Permissions to write settings not granted. Shall they be granted?
VideOSC needs to be able to save settings.
Permissions to write settings were denied
Camera permission is required to display the camera preview.
Permission is not available. Requesting camera permission.
VideOSC is an experimental OSC controller, using the color information retrieved from (one of) the camera(s) of your Android phone.
VideOSC is licensed under the Apache License Version 2.0, January 2004
VideOSC has been created using the following freely available libraries:

netP5 is a utility that helps with network communication. oscP5 is an implementation of the OSC protocol (Open Sound Control) that allows sending control messages between IP/based devices over the network (cable or wireless). Both, netP5 and oscP5 are licensed under the GNU Lesser General Public License [LGPLv3]. http://www.sojamo.de/code/
A kind of Swiss army knife. Licensed under the GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1. http://ketai.org/
Image filters for Android with OpenGL (based on GPUImage for iOS). Homepage: https://github.com/cats-oss/android-gpuimage. Licensed under the Apache License Version 2.0, January 2004
More information about VideOSC can be fount at http://videosc.net
The full application source code can be downloaded from http://github.com/nuss/VideOSC2
